references.reason: This paper provides the foundational framework for online non-stochastic control, which is the basis of the proposed methodology in this paper.

references.paper_title: A contribution to the mathematical theory of epidemics
references.reason: This seminal paper introduces the SIR model, a fundamental epidemiological model that is extended and analyzed in this work.
This book provides the theoretical background for evolutionary game theory which the authors extend to control problems.

references.paper_title: Optimal control of an SIR epidemic through finite-time non-pharmaceutical intervention
references.reason: This work studies optimal control in a classical epidemiological model and serves as a comparison for the new online control methods proposed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Mathematical models in population biology and epidemiology
references.reason: This textbook provides a general overview of mathematical modelling techniques in biology and epidemiology, relevant to the theoretical background of the paper.
